emuInput.TitMainTitle: Director of public and industrial relations for Peoples Cab Company Curtis B. Haines, presenting Westinghouse Electric Roaster to Mr. and Mrs. Alfred Carl Sr., standing by Alfred Carl Jr. seated in cab, in front of People's Cab building with banner inscribed "Arrest accidents, reward: safety"
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 17, 1955, pg. 16 reads: "Safety Slogan Winner - Curtis B. Haines, director of public and industrial relations of the Peoples Cab Company, is presenting a Westinghouse Electric Roaster with cabinet to Mr. and Mrs. Alfred Carl Sr., of 1616 Broadhead Street, as a result of Mrs. Carl giving the exact wording of the Safety Slogan Banner posted on the Peoples Cab Company building. Their son, Alfred Carl Jr., is employed as a cabman by the Peoples Cab Company.  This banner is viewed by thousands of motorists each day.  The banners are changed approximately every two weeks. - Harris Photo."
